definition: leading light/founding father/principal proponent
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
variant of 勛|勋[xun1]
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc

sentences.english: If Rexroth was the founding father, Madeline Gleason was the founding mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果力士樂是開國元勳，麥德蘭格里森是創始母親。

sentences.english: Note the distinction here, evidence of the wisdom of the founding fathers.
sentences.chinese: 注意兩者的區別，這也體現了建國元勳們的智慧。

sentences.english: Liu can become the village in the village of hero, swing-up spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 劉能成了村裏的元勳，在村裏擺起譜來。

sentences.english: Our founders believed in universal values.
sentences.chinese: 美國的開國元勳們相信共同價值。

definition: Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
Ye Ting (1896-1946), communist military leader
national prestige
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
widow
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
pioneer
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
generalissimo
translator (of writings)
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
